meaning: Request parameters embedded in the URL path to identify a resource (variable part of the endpoint path). Example: /users/{user_id}.
A URL path in the API that accepts HTTP requests (e.g., /items, /users/{id}).
Additional key–value pairs after ? in the URL, used for filtering or searching.
Data sent with POST/PUT/PATCH requests, usually JSON.
ASGI web server used to run FastAPI apps. Command: uvicorn main:app
URL-encoded space character used in URL paths and query strings.
Function to add metadata and validation constraints to model fields (defaults, rules, descriptions, etc.).
Data Transfer Object—an object that carries data between processes (e.g., client to server via an API).
Program or device that makes requests to a server (e.g., a browser sending HTTP requests and handling responses).
Structured blueprint defining data organization, types, and rules; a contract for predictable data.
FastAPI dependency injection tool to provide request-ready objects to route handlers.
The actual data carried in an API request or response.
Custom function for per-field validation beyond basic type checks.
Validator that runs on the entire model, with access to multiple fields at once.
